intro: Meriania rigida, commonly known as the hardy meriania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy surface. Meriania rigida is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
